perturbation.original_text: Section 6.1 of the Agreement shall be, and hereby is, amended by deleting the date "September 30, 2003" where it appears therein, and inserting in its place the date "July 20, 2006".
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6.1 of the Agreement shall be, and hereby is, amended by deleting the date "September 30, 2003" where it appears therein, and inserting in its place the date "July 20, 2006". Notwithstanding the foregoing, the agreement may be terminated by any party with 30 days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence contradicts the explicitly stated end date of the agreement. While Section 6.1 sets a specific end date, the added sentence introduces the possibility of early termination, creating uncertainty about the actual duration of the agreement. This undermines the initial fixed term.

perturbation.original_text: Any curtailment under this provision shall be in an amount sufficient to cause the Transmission Line to deliver power at its designed capacity, availability and voltage, or to reduce the Transmission Line line losses, as applicable, up to and including the Projects of all of the LIFO Partners.
perturbation.changed_text: Any curtailment under this provision shall be in an amount deemed appropriate by the Manager, and the Manager may curtail any Partner's project, including but not limited to the LIFO Partners, regardless of whether such curtailment is sufficient to cause the Transmission Line to deliver power at its designed capacity, availability and voltage, or to reduce the Transmission Line line losses. If the curtailment under this provision causes damages for any of the partners that have been curtailed, then the Manager is not responsible for any monetary damages.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that curtailment is limited to what's needed to restore transmission line capacity. The modified version grants the Manager broader discretion to curtail any Partner's project irrespective of necessity and removes liability for resulting damages. This contradicts the original intention of targeted curtailment and introduces ambiguity about the limits of the Manager's authority and their responsibility for any damages.

perturbation.original_text: Except as expressly modified by Section 1 of this Amendment, all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as expressly modified by Section 1 of this Amendment, all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. However, the Manager reserves the right to unilaterally modify any term or condition of this Agreement with written notice to the Partners.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause reinforces that only the modified sections change the agreement. The inserted sentence gives the Manager the power to unilaterally modify any term, which directly conflicts with the statement that terms remain in effect unless explicitly modified in Section 1. This creates uncertainty about which version of the agreement is actually binding at any given time.
